oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 27. 8434). Reed and stone used for cutting purposes. (L VIII.
26. 8313 and 8314). The power of cutting possessed by a reed and by quartz. (L. VII.
21. 7826 rev. and 7827 rev., note). The people break off a piece of the reed and use it to cut already cooked meat (which is easier to cut).
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Skinning and cutting
